page.title: 10Harford Ash Farm,Harford
page.content: The farmhouse,situated opposite Harford church,is 18th century.Its water supply comes off of the moor. Eric Pearse came here to live in 1962 He has been farming for 50 years, having taken over from his father.He starts work at 6.00am and finishs at 5.00pm.He has 150 acres on which he keeps 78 breeding cows and 25 followers(young breeding cattle).The breeds are Hereford crossed with Galloway and Limousine crossed with Galloway.He chose them for their ability to withstand the tough Dart- moor weather.He also keeps sheep. He does not grow crops,except hay, which he feeds to the animals.His favourite job is feeding the cattle, and his worst is cleaning out the pig houses.He has now given up pig-keeping and concentrates on cattle and sheep.
